text.p: Lehman Brothers raised its 1997 and 1998 earnings per share estimates (EPS) for Israel's Tecnomatix Technologies, saying business conditions in the United States, Europe and Asia remain strong.
"We are raising our 1997 EPS estimate to $1.16 from $1.14 and lifting our 1998 EPS estimate to $1.50 from $1.40," analyst Ted Kundtz said in a report.
Lehman had just raised its 1997 estimate for the company in late July. In 1996 Tecnomatix earned $0.82 a share.
"We regard our current estimates as conservative given the potential for large-scale rollouts at major customers over the next two years," the report said.
Lehman said it expects this week's $85 million offering of convertible subordinated notes due 2004 will be non dilutive to earnings.

"Tecnomatix now has $146.2 million of cash and marketable securities, or $13.79 per share. This sizeable cash stockpile gives the company ample flexibility to add strategic acquisitions," the report said.
Lehman reiterated its 1-Buy rating and raised its one-year price target to $43-$45 from $37. The share is at $33-5/8.
